/>
VII.i.2.B.2.a
.
When to Undertake Development to Establish a Common Law Marriage
Develop to establish a common law marriage if
the claimant alleges a common law marriage, or
the evidence
does not establish a claimed ceremonial marriage, but
does support that the parties lived together in a jurisdiction recognizing common law marriages.
Reference
:  For information, on which states recognize common law
marriages, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 2.B.3
.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section B - Establishing Common Law Marriages
citation: Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section B
